name.japanese: フロリアントライアングル

keyEvents.title: Florian Triangle Introduction
keyEvents.description: Kokoro explains that the Florian Triangle is a dangerous area of the Grand Line where hundreds of ships disappear every year without a trace.

description: A mysterious and dangerous area of the Grand Line known for the unexplained disappearance of hundreds of ships every year. Some ships are found adrift with no crew aboard. The Straw Hats must pass through it to reach Fish-Man Island.
geography: A foggy, dark region of the sea in the Grand Line, later revealed to contain Thriller Bark
significance: The setting for the upcoming Thriller Bark arc, known for mysterious disappearances

keyEvents.title: Ship Construction Progress Update
keyEvents.description: The construction of the Straw Hats' new ship continues in Water 7 with Franky, Iceburg, and the Galley-La foremen working late into the night.

keyEvents.title: Franky Family Delivers the Bounty Posters
keyEvents.description: The Franky Family arrives in Water 7 with the news that all Straw Hats now have bounties.

keyEvents.title: Franky Family Pleads for Franky to Join the Straw Hats
keyEvents.description: In Water 7, the Franky Family members plead with Luffy to take Franky with them when they leave due to his wanted status.

description: A water metropolis known for its canals and world-class shipbuilders. Home to the Galley-La Company and the site where the Straw Hats' new ship is being built.
significance: The location where the Straw Hats receive their new ship and where Franky's future is decided

name.japanese: スクラップアイランド

keyEvents.title: Ship Construction Progress Update
keyEvents.description: Franky works at Scrap Island building the Straw Hats' new ship with help from Iceburg and the Galley-La foremen.

description: An island near Water 7 filled with scrap and junk, serving as Franky's base of operations and the construction site for the Thousand Sunny.
significance: The location where Franky builds the Straw Hats' new ship

keyEvents.title: Fish-Man Island Revealed as Grand Line Halfway Point
keyEvents.description: The crew learns that Fish-Man Island represents the halfway point of the Grand Line, marking a significant milestone in their journey.

description: An underwater island that marks the halfway point of the Grand Line. The Straw Hats must pass through the Florian Triangle to reach it.
significance: Represents the midpoint of the Grand Line and a major milestone for the Straw Hat Pirates
